item.title: Common Leadership
item.description:
Tags:
=this.file.frontmatter.tags
Rule:
(Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). For 1 minute, the creature can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d6+Charisma to its roll provided it can hear and understand the creature. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the creature is incapacitated.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Focus Down
item.description:
Rule:
A reaction, a creature can order an ally to attack a a chosen target. Depending on the type of command depends on the bonus.
Bring it down, Advantage against buildings
The wizard, Advantage against casters characters
The barbarian, Advantage against martial characters

item.title: Pounce
item.description: If the creature moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC10+Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the cat can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Rally
item.description:
Rule:
(Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). The Creature shouts a rallying cry and up to three creatures within 60 feet of it that it can see gain 5 (1d10+Charisma) temporary hit points.

Features:

Dwarven Armor Training: Speed not reduced by heavy armour
Dwarven resistance: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.
Dwarven Combat training: You have proficiency with the any weapon with the tag Dwarven
Multi Attack: The creature makes an additional attack for every rank of this value.
Pack tactics: The creature has advantage on attack rolls against another creature if at least one of the attacking creature's allies is within 5 feet of the target creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
Actions:

Common Leadership: (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). For 1 minute, the creature can utter a special command or warning whenever a non-hostile creature that it can see within 60 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d6+Charisma to its roll provided it can hear and understand the creature. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the creature is incapacitated.
Rally: (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). The Creature shouts a rallying cry and up to three creatures within 60 feet of it that it can see gain 5 (1d10+Charisma) temporary hit points.
Weapons:

Reactions:

Endurance: Auto pass one Con save per charge
I'm unstoppable: If the creature would be reduced to 0 hit points, there is a chance that it can instead get back up on one hit dice. If it passes a DC(Last hit damage) save

item.title: Weapons
item.description:
Ammunition: You can use a weapon that has the ammunition property to make a ranged attack only if you have ammunition to fire from the weapon. Each time you attack with the weapon, you expend one piece of ammunition. Drawing the ammunition from a quiver or other container is part of the attack. At the end of the battle, you can recover half your expended ammunition by taking a minute to search the battlefield.
Concealable: This weapon is easily concealed on the body with out major disassembly or effort
Crude: -1 to all damage infliced with this weapon
Finesse: When making an attack with a finesse weapon, you use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.
Heavy: Small creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon’s size and bulk make it too large for a Small creature to use effectively.
Lance: You have disadvantage when you use a lance to attack a target within 5 feet of you. Also, a lance requires two hands to wield when you aren’t mounted.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Martial: Requires proficiency in Martial to use.
Ranged: A weapon that can be used to make a ranged attack has a range in parentheses after the ammunition or thrown property. The range lists two numbers. The first is the weapon’s normal range in feet, and the second indicates the weapon’s long range. When attacking a target beyond normal range, you have disadvantage on the attack roll. You can’t attack a target beyond the weapon’s long range.
Silvered: Some monsters that have immunity or resistance to nonmagical weapons are susceptible to Silver weapons, so cautious adventurers invest extra coin to plate their weapons with silver. You can silver a single weapon or ten pieces of ammunition for 100 gp. This cost represents not only the price of the silver, but the time and expertise needed to add silver to the weapon without making it less effective.
Stealth: This weapon produces minimal sound when used
Thrown: If a weapon has the thrown property, you can throw the weapon to make a ranged attack. If the weapon is a melee weapon, you use the same ability modifier for that attack roll and damage roll that you would use for a melee attack with the weapon
Two-Handed: Takes two hands to use or load.
Versatile: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. A damage value in parentheses appears with the property- the damage when the weapon is used with two hands to make a melee attack.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Factions
item.description:
Without easy trade or communication the once great nations and empires have since splintered and fallen. Now most lands are just small cities and towns hoping to survive another season. Between the walls of civilization lies everything from goblin camps that hunt the peasants, to Bandit kings that prey upon the merchants and their caravans. This is not to say the dead that refused to rest have slowed down their raids and assaults. With the state of the world major wars have stopped now they do what they can to protect their own.
factions follow the following states:

item.title: Ashvale
item.description:
#Town #Ashvale_marches
#Town #Ashvale_marches
The party's base camp from now onwards, A quaint little town, too small for a true castle but big enough for walls and a keep for the mayor. It has most modern amenities you expect from a town this size but anything more specialised will require travel. The lord mayor is the current leader of the town, he swears fealty to his people and to the king of Great palisade but that title has been empty for so long it might as well be meaning less. In modern times he swears fealty to his people and the fellow settlements of the march
Current faction: Ashvale Marches militia
Biome:Forest






Shrine of Vigo


The drunken Mule, the local pub/ tavern where our dear prisoner has a safe house with the owner. A retired dwarven Shield bearer, she helped him out so there is always a place for her in the inn. Beware his daughter works as a barmaid and a little flirting is alright. Too much and you’ll face the ire of the Bar keep. It features all of the needed amenities of an inn and tavern

The shady pub for more illicit dealings
The church of Ordo
Funeral parlour

Shrine of Vigo


The town hall is the current seat of power
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Bitter Frost
item.description:
#Town #Ashvale_marches
#Town #Ashvale_marches
Description: In the corner of the marching mountains lie the city of Bitter frost. Originally built to supply the great palisade with war material. Now it mostly supports Ashvale and surrounding towns.
Current faction: The Bitter Frost Family
Biome: Tundra, Subterrain


The upper district in the mountain home less to foundries and tenement complexes. More to offices and noble housing for the elites of this Fort.

Exceptional and artisanal that is IB blades currently the only forge still in the Sky district they arm the royal guards and Most of the Nobles all use axes forged by them.

The middle district home to the great gates of Bitter frost. this is the middle class and tourist district. You need work, you need gear and your need a place to rest you'll find it here.

The grand gate of Bitter frost is the only way out


A stock mass production forge. cheap and effective is their motto. 75% of the axes and armour is produced by them.


A black smith with a penchant for strange and effective gear will work for less if the work is interesting or challenging
The old city and it's catacombs

Ares Proving ground

The church of Ordo

Funeral parlour

item.title: Dragonborn
item.description:
#Civilised
#Civilised
Lore:
The dragonborn have pulled in only found in the major cities of man and their sole city the volcano Ashbloom. They have not sealed themselves away like the elves or turned their city into a mausoleum for the dead instead they have begun to research and learn all they can about the fog and the end of death.

item.title: Dwarfs
item.description:
#Civilised
#Civilised
Lore:
The dwarfs have turned their mighty forts and cities into crypts to protect their ancestors' souls and bodies from the foul corruption plaguing the land. This has led to them joining the land of the men as miners and smiths. Many noble houses and cities have parlayed these traveling smiths. In the hope their blades may give them an edge over what lurks outside the walls.

item.title: Orcs
item.description:
#Barbaric
#Barbaric
Lore:
The mighty orcs of the steppes have not been safe from this corruption as their once vast plains and clear skies have been polluted with the same fog and cloud. That plagues the land of men. This has ruined the mighty pastures that fed their herds of ox and horse. Causing them to have to raid further and further into the lands of men to feed both tribe and herd.

item.title: Races
item.description:
The races of this misbegotten land can be broken into three main groups the civilised folk, the frontier folk and the fallen.

Humans

#Civilised
Lore:
The Humans have pulled in towards their cities. Anything too small for a true wall has been left behind to defend for themselves as small hillocks and frontier settlements. There is talk of once proud cities falling in the night either to organised undead or something more insidious. Is just talking to scare children and old tavern tales.

This has led to them joining the land of the men as miners and smiths. Many noble houses and cities have parlayed these traveling smiths. Small Folk

#Civilised
Lore:
The halflings and gnomes are fleeing to cities of men as their once idyllic homeland has been twisted and corrupted. The long fields of grain once the breadbasket of the civilized worlds now lie in ruin. foul ravens twisted into unnatural shapes, have risen. The are few of the small folk uncontent to live out their days in the cities on man and long for their homelands. As such they have begun a march to clear out the foul ravens and figure out a way to purify their land.

item.title: Small Folk
item.description:
#Civilised
#Civilised
Lore:
The halflings and gnomes are fleeing to cities of men as their once idyllic homeland has been twisted and corrupted. The long fields of grain once the breadbasket of the civilized worlds now lie in ruin. foul ravens twisted into unnatural shapes, have risen. The are few of the small folk uncontent to live out their days in the cities on man and long for their homelands. As such they have begun a march to clear out the foul ravens and figure out a way to purify their land.

item.title: Ashen King
item.description:
Domain: Death
The Ashen king, one of the Lords of the pantheon, whose Domain is death.
The King has disappeared and is unreachable by his followers (The Burnt Church or The Cult of the Hanged man). Despite the loss of connection, they can still call upon his power to both to hold back the risen and to return them to their final peace. With the dead no longer staying dead, this has led to little, if any, hunting or fishing as every kill, every catch, and every hunt must be sanctified by a priest; otherwise the dead and butchered flesh will begin to rise again.
It was said that a greedy count did not care for the rules and rites, and so he dined (unsanctified flesh has a strange habit of waking up when you least expect it). In this poor fellow’s case, it was while it was inside of him, pulling and stretching his body. It killed him when it erupted, but his peace didn’t last long, as he soon returned. The foul flesh and his own became one, he now wanders the halls of his once grand castle.

item.title: Curses
item.description:
#Curse
#Curse

You are cursed to die to a great beast the question is where do you draw the line between man and beast.

You have loved and lost someone close to you. Now you feel like love has been damped both towards you and towards those you love

Your magic is weaker and has a weaker effect on you. Be it from the cleric or the wizard.

You are more vulnerable to fire damage but you feel unable to feel the warmth and heat.

The steel you wield and the steel used against you is weakened by your presence, make of that what you will. You lose 1 ac with steel based armour and you lose 1d4 damaged to your attacks with a steel weapon. If you are hit by a steel weapon you reduce the damage by 1d4

You have developed a sensitivity to silver, you take more damage when exposed to silver. Either through attacks or by wielding silvered weapons  you take 1d4-1 damage a attack or turn

You are cursed with an unnatural hunger for flesh and blood.

You are cursed with the blood of a demon**
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Economics
item.description:
What little trade that happens is through armoured and armed caravans from town to town. Harvests are meagre at best from the near constant rain and fog. In some places there are people who have never seen the sun or remember what the world was once like. The one industry that is doing well is arms and armour. With the most successful kingdoms being those with access to master smiths and cannon makers.  Currency has had to simplify to improve trade so only gold coins are used. This is reflected in the rule:
Generic money

All money is measured in GP with gem/ other assets being either converted into it. However, this means that prices are inaccurate relative to external sources for this just add an extra zero to all GP prices.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

Without easy trade or communication the once great nations and empires have since splintered and fallen. Now most lands are just small cities and towns hoping to survive another season. Between the walls of civilization lies everything from goblin camps that hunt the peasants, to Bandit kings that prey upon the merchants and their caravans. This is not to say the dead that refused to rest have slowed down their raids and assaults. With the state of the world major wars have stopped now they do what they can to protect their own.

item.title: The Cursed
item.description:
#Curse
#Curse
Those that have been cursed by the ways of magic are isolated and sent to prisons around the land to stop this magical contagion from spreading around the world. Even the guards of these forgotten points are cursed that willingly went to the prisons. Some say curses can be spread by contact with the cursed. Some say that it is an affliction that only affects those that stand against the gods. I say those that take the ire of any sufficiently powerful being be it wizard or higher being are cursed.

It was said by a seer long back when there were nations and empires that a group known as the noble cursed would stop the cause of the fog and in doing so would be freed from their curses. It is said that to prove themselves as the noble cursed. Another story claims that they’ll have to defeat mighty beings said to be causing this chaos but I claim that is just some myth to try to keep hope going.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Advance harpoonery
item.description:
stats
Harpoon gun 1d8 piercing+dex 10 lb Heavy, (range 15/30), Special, Recallable, Reloading
The harpoon gun was originally  used for catching whales. Over the years, whalers have discovered it's also very effective as a weapon to hunt other creatures.
Special. When you deal damage to a creature with a harpoon, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw against a DC of 10+ users bonus or be harpooned. While harpooned, the target's movement speed is reduced to half and it is unable to take the Dash action. The harpoon is connected to a trailing rope. If you control the trailing rope, the target can't move away from you further than 30 feet, unless it succeeds on a contested Strength (Athletics) check. A harpooned creature trying to cast a spell, must succeed on a Concentration check against a DC 10 or loses the spell. A creature can remove the harpoon from its body as an action. The creature must have at least one free hand to do so. Removing the harpoon causes damage equal to the damage die of the harpoon (without modifiers).
Recallable. The harpoon gun contains one harpoon that can be manually recalled back to the gun as a reaction or bonus action. The target impacted must make a contested strength check against the wielder. 
Reloading. In the event that the harpoon is broken or unable to be recalled it may be discarded and replaced in doing so takes one full action to replace and reload the gun. If undamaged the discarded harpoon may be gathered for reuse after battle.

This can be infused like any other item and once done gains the effects of that infusion. Here are the infusions specific to this item:

Serrated blades- chance to inflict bleed on hit enemies
Hardened tip- +2 to getting stuck in enemies 
Electro bolt gains- 1d4 lightning damage

item.title: Kawflev’s Vessel
item.description:
#Unique_Item
#Unique_Item

A vessel for the spirit of Kawflev, who is currently in the form of an Attic Whisperer, with access to all its powers. He normally appears sitting on the owner's shoulders. He can hide his form at will, but is bound to the vessel. If it is destroyed, his soul is lost to the ether. The vessel roughly resembles a coffin for a small child. The lid is adorned with a childlike drawing of a fox's skull. When not residing within the vessel, he can perform any of his abilities. While out of combat he tends to play with children's toys. Every day, he regains 1d4 charges per day (to a max of 6) and can use the following abilities:

Aura of Sobs
All of the voices that an Attic Whisperer steals linger around it in an invisible, but audible, aura of unnerving, childlike whimpers, songs, and sobs. The Attic Whisperer can suppress or reactivate its aura as a bonus action. This aura is a sonic, mind-affecting effect. It takes 1 charge per turn to change mode and it takes 1 charge to focus it on a particular character within 30ft of the vessel. Any living creature that enters this area loses the benefit of all bardic performances affecting it and takes a –1 penalty on all attack, damage, and will saving throws.
Steal Breath
A creature bitten by an Attic Whisperer must make a DC16 will save, or become fatigued for 1 hour. A fatigued creature that is bitten, is instead exhausted for 1 hour. An exhausted creature falls asleep for 1 hour. The sleeper can only be roused by killing the Attic Whisperer or by using Dispel Magic, Remove Curse, or similar effects. The save DC is your current spell save.
Steal Voice
Any creature hit by an Attic Whisperer’s touch must make a DC16 will save or lose its ability to speak for 1 hour. During that time, the creature cannot talk, cast spells with verbal components, use auditory bardic performances, or use any other ability that requires speech. Once an Attic Whisperer has stolen a creature’s voice, it can perfectly mimic that voice at any time, even after its victim’s voice has returned, and (while using that voice) can speak any languages the victim knows. Those familiar with an individual’s voice can make a Sense Motive check opposed by the Attic Whisperer’s Bluff check to realize a mimicked voice is inauthentic. The save DC is your current spell save. On a successful hit, it generates 1d4 charges.
13hp
12
item.guid: Go Team Edge Lord/Magical items/Player items/Kawflev’s Vessel.md

Bitter Frost

#Town #Ashvale_marches
Description: In the corner of the marching mountains lie the city of Bitter frost. Originally built to supply the great palisade with war material. Now it mostly supports Ashvale and surrounding towns.
Current faction: The Bitter Frost Family
Biome: Tundra, Subterrain


The upper district in the mountain home less to foundries and tenement complexes. More to offices and noble housing for the elites of this Fort.

Exceptional and artisanal that is IB blades currently the only forge still in the Sky district they arm the royal guards and Most of the Nobles all use axes forged by them.

The middle district home to the great gates of Bitter frost. this is the middle class and tourist district. You need work, you need gear and your need a place to rest you'll find it here.

The grand gate of Bitter frost is the only way out


A stock mass production forge. cheap and effective is their motto. 75% of the axes and armour is produced by them.


A black smith with a penchant for strange and effective gear will work for less if the work is interesting or challenging

Rule:
(Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). For 1 minute, the creature can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4+Charisma to its roll provided it can hear and understand the creature. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. item.title: Combat
item.description:
Crits
Crits automatically maximize the first set of damage dice.
Example: Fighter crits with a longsword. Instead of dealing 2d8 + STR damage, deal 8 + 1d8 + STR
Reasoning: dealing 2 damage on a crit feels stupid and counter-intuitive
Charging
Charging spends your move to get into range with an enemy gains +2 to hit for that turn
Taking point
By taking point you get a plus 2 on initiative and allies can move through your tile
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Degrees of success
item.description: Better bonus / results the higher you are over the DC
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Dissociate skills
item.description: Dissociate skills from stats, at least partially. Using Intimidate as an example: Sure, you may be able to intimidate somebody with your charisma, but if you're a Goliath Barbarian trying to intimidate somebody by your sheer physical presence, Intimidate (Str) or Intimidate (Con) may be appropriate. If you're a Wizard trying to intimidate someone with your magical prowess, Intimidate (Int) might make sense. If you're Monk trying to stop a creature from running away because you are way too fast to escape, Intimidate (Dex) is fitting. The same is true for other checks. Survival(Con) if you're trying to endure the elements of a harsh landscape, or maybe Str to make your way through physically demanding terrain quickly. Perception (Con) if you're trying to perceive a slight tremor, Perception (Int) if you're trying to detect a magical field, and so on.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Generic money
item.description: All money is measured in GP with gem/ other assets being either converted into it. However, this means that prices are inaccurate relative to external sources for this just add an extra zero to all GP prices.
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Insomnia
item.description:
A con save to fall asleep with the DC starting at 20 after 8 hours of activity, every hour after 8 decreases the DC by 1.
Essential oils give a +2 to falling asleep but are spent after being used
item.dc:creator: Lastofthebet

item.title: Rolling for magic and magic perils
item.description:
#Casting
#Casting
When casting a roll of 10 plus level of the spell is the DC needed for the cast, half DC is a roll on the perils table. Rolling a one on a spell causes the caster to roll on the perils table twice. You can raise the power of a spell at the cost of a guaranteed perils roll.
